article: Which Method Do You Think Better?  By the time that a student reaches his senior year in high school, he is likely to believe that he is an expert in reading. No matter how _ he is, he can still improve. How do you read an article in a textbook? Do you have a certain _ of doing it or do you just _ at the beginning and keep reading _ you come to the end?  _ students say that they use the " slow and sure" method. By this they mean they read every sentence slowly and _ . Every time they come to an _ word they stop to think what it means and, if necessary, look it up in the _ . In this method a person _ has no time left for _ what he has read, for he has used all his _ in trying to get the meaning of each word to be sure that he _ everything. Other students use what has been _ the "review" method. Here a person tries to arrange his time so that he can read his lesson at least twice. This type of reading is faster than the " slow and sure" method, for the lesson _ be read rapidly or there will not be _ time left for a second reading.
